author: The Telegraph
title: Adventures galore with Disney Holidays
text: Whether you have always wanted to set foot on a tropical island, cruise through a steamy jungle or sample African street food, all sorts of explorers will find their kind of adventure on an ultimate Disney Holiday . Walt Disney World’s six parks and the Disney Cruise Line ships give holidaymakers the chance to see – and indeed touch, hear, even smell and taste – wonderful things you may never encounter otherwise. If you want to have fun together as a family, or do you own thing for a while, you can build your own ultimate adventure to explore, experience and enjoy. At Epcot, with pavilions representing 11 different countries, every family member can be taken on a fascinating journey around the world. While the youngsters make music at the interactive play area known as the What If Labs, grown-ups can discover all about Moroccan body art at the Gallery of Arts and History. The Indiana Jones Epic Stunt Spectacular provides unmissable thrills Be sure to try the varied cuisines at Epcot’s World Showcase, where you can tuck into everything from Mexican tacos to sushi in Japan. Another Epcot highlight is Future World, where you can blast off on a journey through space and experience surprises galore as you travel on a tram through Dr Channing’s sensory labs. More delights follow in the Turtle Talk theatre where you enter Crush’s ocean world. Here is your chance to pick the knowledgeable turtle’s brain on anything from marine biology to Finding Nemo film facts in a real-time question-and-answer session. At Disney’s Hollywood Studios, the Indiana Jones Epic Stunt Spectacular provides unmissable thrills. Here the big screen’s ultimate explorer takes on dangerous bad guys, leaps from tall buildings and makes other daring moves as fake bullets fly. The adventure comes to a climax in an explosive finale. Adults can even volunteer as “extras” and be part of the action. And, while Indiana Jones negotiates traps, villains and epic obstacles, a director explains the movie magic. Out of Africa: go giraffe spotting on an Animal Kingdom safari Learn the difference between stunt doubles and stunt actors, and watch demonstrations of fight routines, learn how to safely throw and take punches, fall from tall buildings, and wield whips in the midst of complex action sequences. Little ones will love Disney Junior Live at Disney’s Hollywood Studios. Here, enchanting puppets invite tots to sing, dance and play – just watch their faces as Mickey, Minnie and friends from Mickey Mouse Clubhouse and their favourite Disney Junior characters, including Sofia the First, Doc McStuffins, and Jake and the Neverland Pirates, appear on stage to kick off the fun. Disney’s Animal Kingdom is the largest animal theme park in the world with more than 1,700 animals across 250 species. Take the family on a Kilimanjaro Safari for a unique experience in which you will ride in an open-air vehicle through lush African savannah, and spot exotic animals such as lions, elephants, hippos, zebras and giraffes – there is every chance that you may encounter 34 species of African animals, so have your camera ready. Come feeding time, the Animal Kingdom has a huge variety of dining options for humans. The new Harambe Market offers you the chance to try African street food for dinner, including boerewors sausage dipped in curry-infused corn batter. Wind your way through the jungle in an all-terrain vehicle And Jiko - The Cooking Place at the Animal Kingdom Lodge offers African, Indian and Mediterranean cuisine together with the biggest South African wine list outside South Africa. Your world of discovery continues on board your Disney Cruise Line ship as you sail off to explore the exotic islands of the Caribbean or the Bahamas. Take a western Caribbean cruise and you will embark on a fun-packed, scenic journey from Port Canaveral or Miami to sun-kissed idylls such as Grand Cayman, Cozumel and Jamaica, with a choice of exciting port adventures at each destination. In the Mexican island of Cozumel, for example, there is the chance to wind your way through the jungle on an all-terrain vehicle. Or in Jamaica you could travel through the treetops on a canopy zip line. You will also drop anchor at Castaway Cay, the paradise isle that is reserved exclusively for guests on Disney Cruise Line’s Bahamian and Caribbean cruise holidays. Beach life: Castaway Cay offers alfresco massages with an ocean view Who has not dreamt of stepping foot on the bone-white beach of a sun-kissed, tropical island lapped by turquoise waters? Especially one offering snorkelling, boating and other water sports, BBQs, a private beach and yoga lessons for adults, a teens-only activity area, and a huge stretch of sand where the whole family can spend quality time together. In Castaway Cay there is everything busy explorers need to enjoy themselves – including alfresco massages with an ocean view, ice-cold cocktails and lovely warm, white sand to relax on. And as you drift from one idyllic isle to the next, on board your Disney Cruise Line ship, the action continues. With a host of activities and entertainment, including deck parties, basketball courts, fabulous shows and kids clubs, every voyage includes the attention to detail and world-class hospitality that only Disney can provide. • Find out more about Disney Cruises, Disney holidays and Walt Disney World
